verses.verse: Why, <S%H4069><s%> seeing times <S%H6256><s%> are not hidden <S%H6845><s%> from the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> do they that know <S%H5234><s%> him not see <S%H2372><s%> his days? <S%H3117><s%>
Some remove <S%H5472><s%> the landmarks; <S%H1367><s%> they violently <S%H1497><s%> take <S%H1497><s%> away flocks, <S%H5739><s%> and feed <S%H7462><s%> thereof.
They drive <S%H5090><s%> away the ass <S%H2543><s%> of the fatherless, <S%H3490><s%> they take <S%H2254><s%> the widow's <S%H490><s%> ox <S%H7794><s%> for a pledge. <S%H2254><s%>
They turn <S%H5186><s%> the needy <S%H34><s%> out of the way: <S%H1870><s%> the poor <S%H6035><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> hide <S%H2244><s%> themselves together. <S%H3162><s%>

Behold, <S%H2005><s%> as wild <S%H6501><s%> asses <S%H6501><s%> in the desert, <S%H4057><s%> go <S%H3318><s%> they forth <S%H3318><s%> to their work; <S%H6467><s%> rising <S%H7836><s%> betimes <S%H7836><s%> for a prey: <S%H2964><s%> the wilderness <S%H6160><s%> yields food <S%H3899><s%> for them and for their children. <S%H5288><s%>
They reap <S%H7114><s%> every one his corn <S%H1098><s%> in the field: <S%H7704><s%> and they gather <S%H3953><s%> the vintage <S%H3754><s%> of the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>
They cause the naked <S%H6174><s%> to lodge <S%H3885><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> clothing, <S%H3830><s%> that they have no <S%H369><s%> covering <S%H3682><s%> in the cold. <S%H7135><s%>
They are wet <S%H7372><s%> with the showers <S%H2230><s%> of the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> and embrace <S%H2263><s%> the rock <S%H6697><s%> for want <S%H1097><s%> of a shelter. <S%H4268><s%>
They pluck <S%H1497><s%> the fatherless <S%H3490><s%> from the breast, <S%H7699><s%> and take <S%H2254><s%> a pledge <S%H2254><s%> of the poor. <S%H6041><s%>
They cause him to go <S%H1980><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> clothing, <S%H3830><s%> and they take <S%H5375><s%> away the sheaf <S%H6016><s%> from the hungry; <S%H7456><s%>
Which make oil <S%H6671><s%> within <S%H996><s%> their walls, <S%H7791><s%> and tread <S%H1869><s%> their winepresses, <S%H3342><s%> and suffer thirst. <S%H6770><s%>

Men <S%H4962><s%> groan <S%H5008><s%> from out of the city, <S%H5892><s%> and the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the wounded <S%H2491><s%> cries <S%H7768><s%> out: yet God <S%H433><s%> lays <S%H7760><s%> not folly <S%H8604><s%> to them.

They are of those that rebel <S%H4775><s%> against the light; <S%H216><s%> they know <S%H5234><s%> not the ways <S%H1870><s%> thereof, nor <S%H3808><s%> abide <S%H3427><s%> in the paths <S%H5410><s%> thereof.

The murderer <S%H7523><s%> rising <S%H6965><s%> with the light <S%H216><s%> kills <S%H6991><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy, <S%H34><s%> and in the night <S%H3915><s%> is as a thief. <S%H1590><s%>

The eye <S%H5869><s%> also of the adulterer <S%H5003><s%> waits <S%H8104><s%> for the twilight, <S%H5399><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> No <S%H3808><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H7789><s%> me: and disguises <S%H5643><s%> his face. <S%H6440><s%>

In the dark <S%H2822><s%> they dig <S%H2864><s%> through <S%H2864><s%> houses, <S%H1004><s%> which they had marked <S%H2856><s%> for themselves in the daytime: <S%H3119><s%> they know <S%H3045><s%> not the light. <S%H216><s%>

For the morning <S%H1242><s%> is to them even as the shadow <S%H6757><s%> of death: <S%H6757><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> one know <S%H5234><s%> them, they are in the terrors <S%H1091><s%> of the shadow <S%H6757><s%> of death. <S%H6757><s%>

He is swift <S%H7031><s%> as the waters; <S%H4325><s%> their portion <S%H2513><s%> is cursed <S%H7043><s%> in the earth: <S%H776><s%> he beholds <S%H6437><s%> not the way <S%H1870><s%> of the vineyards. <S%H3754><s%>
Drought <S%H6723><s%> and heat <S%H2527><s%> consume <S%H1497><s%> the snow <S%H7950><s%> waters: <S%H4325><s%> so does the grave <S%H7585><s%> those which have sinned. <S%H2398><s%>

The womb <S%H7358><s%> shall forget <S%H7911><s%> him; the worm <S%H7415><s%> shall feed sweetly <S%H4988><s%> on him; he shall be no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> remembered; <S%H2142><s%> and wickedness <S%H5766><s%> shall be broken <S%H7665><s%> as a tree. <S%H6086><s%>
He evil <S%H7462><s%> entreats the barren <S%H6135><s%> that bears <S%H3205><s%> not: and does not good <S%H3190><s%> to the widow. <S%H490><s%>
He draws <S%H4900><s%> also the mighty <S%H47><s%> with his power: <S%H3581><s%> he rises <S%H6965><s%> up, and no <S%H3808><s%> man is sure <S%H539><s%> of life. <S%H2416><s%>
Though it be given <S%H5414><s%> him to be in safety, <S%H983><s%> where on he rests; <S%H8172><s%> yet his eyes <S%H5869><s%> are on their ways. <S%H1870><s%>

They are exalted <S%H7426><s%> for a little <S%H4592><s%> while, but are gone <S%H369><s%> and brought <S%H4355><s%> low; <S%H4355><s%> they are taken <S%H7092><s%> out of the way <S%H1870><s%> as all <S%H3605><s%> other, and cut <S%H5243><s%> off as the tops <S%H7218><s%> of the ears <S%H7641><s%> of corn.
And if <S%H518><s%> it be not so now, <S%H645><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> will make <S%H7760><s%> me a liar, <S%H3576><s%> and make <S%H7760><s%> my speech <S%H4405><s%> nothing <S%H408><s%> worth?
